QAPair.Question: What is (are) McCune-Albright syndrome ?
QAPair.Answer: McCune-Albright syndrome is a genetic disease that affects the bones, hormones, and color (pigmentation) of the skin.

QAPair.Question: What causes McCune-Albright syndrome ?
QAPair.Answer: McCune-Albright syndrome is caused by mutations in the GNAS gene. A small number, but not all, of the person's cells contain this faulty gene (mosaicism). This disease is not inherited.

QAPair.Question: What are the symptoms of McCune-Albright syndrome ?
QAPair.Answer: The main symptom of McCune-Albright syndrome is early puberty in girls. Menstrual periods may begin in early childhood, long before the breasts or pubic hair develop (which normally occur first). The average age that symptoms appear is 3 years old. However, puberty and menstrual bleeding have occurred as early as 4 to 6 months in girls. Early sexual development may also occur in boys, but not as often as in girls. Other symptoms include: Bone fractures, Deformities of the bones in the face, Gigantism , Irregular, large patchy café au lait spots ,

QAPair.Question: How to diagnose McCune-Albright syndrome ?
QAPair.Answer: A physical examination may show signs of: Abnormal bone growth in the skull, Abnormal heart rhythms ( arrhythmias ), Acromegaly , Gigantism, Large cafe-au-lait spots on the skin, Liver disease, jaundice, fatty liver, Scar-like tissue in the bone ( fibrous dysplasia ) , Tests may show: Adrenal abnormalities, High level of parathyroid hormone ( hyperparathyroidism ), High level of thyroid hormone ( hyperthyroidism ) , Adrenal hormone abnormalities, Low level of phosphorous in the blood ( hypophosphatemia ), Ovarian cysts , Pituitary or thyroid tumors , Abnormal blood prolactin level, Abnormal growth hormone level , Other tests that may be done include: MRI of the head , X-rays of the bones , Genetic testing may be done to confirm the diagnosis.

QAPair.Question: What are the treatments for McCune-Albright syndrome ?
QAPair.Answer: There is no specific treatment for McCune-Albright syndrome. Drugs that block estrogen production, such as testolactone, have been tried with some success. Adrenal abnormalities (such as Cushing syndrome ) may be treated with surgery to remove the adrenal glands. Gigantism and pituitary adenoma will need to be treated with medicines that block hormone production, or with surgery. Bone abnormalities (fibrous dysplasia) are sometimes removed with surgery. Limit the number of x-rays taken of affected areas of the body.

QAPair.Question: What is the outlook for McCune-Albright syndrome ?
What are the complications of McCune-Albright syndrome ?
QAPair.Answer: Complications may include: Blindness , Cosmetic problems from bone abnormalities, Deafness , Osteitis fibrosa cystica , Premature puberty, Repeated broken bones, Tumors of the bone (rare),

Question.qtype: when to contact a medical professional

QAPair.Question: Do I need to see a doctor for McCune-Albright syndrome ?
QAPair.Answer: Contact your health care provider if your child starts puberty early, or has other symptoms of McCune-Albright syndrome. Genetic counseling, and possibly genetic testing, may be suggested if the disease is detected.
